thread.title: Mardi Gras float mocks Atlanta Falcons’ Super Bowl 2017 loss
thread.title_full: Mardi Gras float mocks Atlanta Falcons’ Super Bowl 2017 loss

author: AJC Sports
title: Mardi Gras float mocks Atlanta Falcons’ Super Bowl 2017 loss
text:
Saints fans are celebrating the Atlanta Falcons’ Super Bowl loss with a Mardi Gras float that features a “ringless” Matt Ryan, “Dirty Bird” gumbo and a voodoo doll, signaling it as the reason for Atlanta’s soul-crushing second half flop against the New England Patriots.
The float takes some liberty with the Chick-fil-A cows’ signature writing and takes a few other shots at other teams, notably Chicago, Carolina and Arizona.
Bradley: Six hidden reason Falcons lost Super Bowl
The Krewe of Bacchus float hits the parade route Sunday, Feb. 26, through Uptown New Orleans.
Here are some shots of the from the open house this week in New Orleans:
They got a Ringless Float for the Falcons @ Mardi Gras. I love my city lmao. pic.twitter.com/y2pCoOV2Qo
— Nader Mirfiq (@Nader723) February 13, 2017 Where to celebrate Mardi Gras in Atlanta
The top of the float (edited) :
Isaza, Rudolf (CMG-Atlanta)
The front of the float:
#DirtyBirdGumbo #RiseUp #Saints pic.twitter.com/xvi8xe6VfW
— Darth Saint (@Darth_Saint) February 14, 2017 The Falcons swept the Saints in the NFC rivalry this season, and lead the team series 51-45. Atlanta has been to two Super Bowls and won none. The Saints won the Super Bowl in 2010.
